description: Advanced battle tactics for Castle Battles, Foundry Clash, Frostfire Mine, and other competitive events

castle_battles.name: Castle Battles / Facility Battles
castle_battles.description: Tactics for attacking and defending facilities like Sunfire Castle, Bear Trap buildings, and SvS facilities
castle_battles.overview: Castle battles are won through coordination, timing, and overwhelming force. A well-timed double rally beats a stronger garrison every time.

double_rally.name: Double Rally (Synchronized Strike)
double_rally.description: Two rallies timed to hit the exact same second, overwhelming even strong garrisons
how_it_works: Two rally leaders start rallies against the same target
Coordinate countdown so both rallies LAND at the exact same time
Garrison can only defend against one rally at a time
Second rally hits while garrison is still fighting first rally
Combined damage often wipes garrison that could handle either rally alone
execution_tips: Use voice chat (Discord) for precise countdown
Account for march time differences - farther leader starts first
Standard countdown: '3... 2... 1... GO' on rally launch
Both leaders should have similar march speeds
Practice with alliance before important battles
double_rally.why_effective: A garrison of 2M troops might beat a 1.5M rally, but two 1.5M rallies hitting simultaneously = 3M attackers vs 2M defenders. The math changes completely.
common_mistakes: Starting rallies at same time instead of timing ARRIVAL
Not accounting for different march speeds
Poor communication leading to 5-10 second gaps

post_rally_swarm.name: Post-Rally Troop Swarm
post_rally_swarm.description: Individual attacks timed to arrive immediately after double rally, before enemy can reinforce
how_it_works: Double rally wipes or heavily damages garrison
Pre-staged individual marches arrive 1-5 seconds after rally lands
These 'cleanup' attacks hit the weakened/empty facility
Enemy has no time to send new garrison troops
Facility flips to your alliance before reinforcements arrive
execution_tips: Have 5-10 players stage attacks timed to land RIGHT after rally
Use faster march speeds or closer positions
Stagger arrivals by 1-2 seconds to maintain pressure
First individual attack should aim to land within 3 seconds of rally
Keep sending waves until facility is secured
post_rally_swarm.timing_window: You typically have 10-30 seconds before enemy can react and send new garrison. Use this window aggressively.

garrison_sandwich.name: Garrison Sandwich
garrison_sandwich.description: Time reinforcement troops to arrive between double rally hits
how_it_works: First rally hits and engages garrison
Individual troop marches arrive DURING the battle
Second rally hits while garrison is split/engaged
Reinforcement troops add to attacking power mid-battle
garrison_sandwich.advanced_note: This requires very precise timing and is harder to execute than standard double rally. Use only with experienced coordinators.

rally_chain.name: Rally Chain (Sustained Pressure)
rally_chain.description: Multiple rallies hitting in sequence to maintain constant pressure
how_it_works: Rally 1 hits, damages garrison
Rally 2 hits 30-60 seconds later on weakened garrison
Rally 3 follows up if needed
Enemy cannot rebuild garrison between hits
when_to_use: When you have more rally leaders than enemy has garrison capacity
When double rally alone isn't enough

feint_rally.name: Feint Rally (Bait and Switch)
feint_rally.description: Start a rally to draw garrison, then cancel and hit real target
how_it_works: Start rally against decoy target (visible to enemy)
Enemy moves garrison troops to defend
Cancel rally at last moment
Immediately double rally the REAL target (now undefended)
feint_rally.risks: Enemy may call your bluff. Only works against reactive defenders.

garrison_rotation.name: Garrison Rotation
garrison_rotation.description: Keeping fresh troops in garrison at all times
how_it_works: Assign garrison slots to specific players
When rally is incoming, garrison commander calls for reinforcements
Fresh troops replace wounded troops immediately after battle
Never leave garrison empty or below capacity
tips: Use highest troop count players for garrison
Have backup garrison players ready
Rotate between battles to spread healing costs

counter_timing.name: Counter-Timing
counter_timing.description: Sending garrison troops timed to arrive DURING enemy rally
how_it_works: Watch incoming rally timer
Calculate when your troops will arrive
Send reinforcements timed to land DURING the battle
Your fresh troops join mid-fight, turning the tide
counter_timing.math: A 2M garrison fighting a 3M rally is losing. But 500K fresh troops arriving mid-battle can swing it back.

anti_swarm.name: Anti-Swarm Protocol
how_it_works: Immediately after surviving a rally, flood garrison with troops
Don't wait to see if more attacks are coming
Multiple players send small reinforcements simultaneously
Overwhelm the 'cleanup' attacks with numbers
anti_swarm.key_insight: Enemy expects you to be slow. React in under 5 seconds to deny their swarm.

coordination_requirements.voice_chat: Discord or similar - text chat is too slow for precise timing
coordination_requirements.rally_leaders: Need 2+ strong rally leaders for double rally
coordination_requirements.scout_reports: Know enemy garrison strength before attacking
coordination_requirements.march_calculators: Know exact march times for coordination
coordination_requirements.backup_plans: Have Plan B if double rally fails

common_mistakes.mistake: Launching rallies at the same TIME instead of timing ARRIVAL
common_mistakes.correction: Account for different march distances. Farther rally starts first so both LAND together.

common_mistakes.mistake: No follow-up after successful double rally
common_mistakes.correction: Have players staged to send individual attacks immediately. Don't give enemy time to react.

common_mistakes.mistake: Garrison is empty after a battle
common_mistakes.correction: Assign backup garrison players. Fresh troops should arrive within 5-10 seconds of battle ending.
Always scout first. Know if you need double rally or triple rally based on garrison strength.

common_mistakes.mistake: Using text chat for timing coordination
common_mistakes.correction: Voice chat only for double rallies. The 2-3 second delay in text can ruin timing.

double_rally_checklist: Both rally leaders ready with full troops
March times calculated for simultaneous arrival

foundry.name: Foundry Clash (Foundry Battle)
foundry.description: Biweekly Alliance-vs-Alliance event fighting for control of an imperial weapons foundry
foundry.overview: A 60-minute strategic battle where alliances compete to capture buildings and accumulate Arsenal Points. Buildings generate points over time when controlled.

event_basics.team_size: Up to 2 Legions (30 combatants + 10 substitutes each = 80 total)

requirements.timing: Must join alliance BEFORE registration closes

event_basics.key_mechanic: Troops don't die - all casualties are injuries only, automatic healing after battle

phase_1.priority: Secure Transit Station FIRST (50% teleport cooldown reduction)

phase_2.priority: Imperial Foundry is highest value target

imperial_foundry.note: Highest value target in the event

phase_1_strategy.name: Phase 1 Opening
steps: Rush Transit Station by sending your 2 fastest march-speed players at 0:00 - teleport adjacent and capture before enemy arrives
Capture Boiler Room with your next 2 players - the 50% faster capture time helps all future building takes
Split remaining players to Prototype Sites (2 per site) - these generate 1,200 pts/min each
Establish defensive positions by leaving 2 players garrisoned at each captured building - never leave buildings empty

phase_2_strategy.name: Phase 2 Push
steps: Send A1 team (8 strongest) to Imperial Foundry - coordinate arrival with double rally timing
Double rally Imperial Foundry: A1 leader starts rally, A2 leader follows 10 seconds later so both land together
Control Munitions Warehouse with 3 players after Foundry is secure - the +15% damage buff helps all future fights
Deploy Mercenary Camp strike teams against enemy gatherers on the mini-map - free harassment while you hold positions

phase_3_strategy.name: Phase 3 Cleanup
steps: Hunt Weapon Workshops by watching the mini-map for spawn alerts - send your closest available player immediately
Maintain control by keeping 2-3 defenders per high-value building - rotate wounded players out to heal
If trailing by 20%+ points, send 4 players to target unguarded neutral sites while defenders hold
Final push at 5 min remaining: call all available players to mass assault the highest-value enemy building

point_looting.name: Point Scattering Mechanic
point_looting.description: When enemies lose buildings, 50% of accumulated points scatter as lootable supplies
point_looting.tip: Watch the mini-map for yellow dots - these are free points!

smart_recovery.name: 12-Minute Reset
smart_recovery.description: Leave battlefield for 12 minutes for full heal instead of using speedups
smart_recovery.when_to_use: When not in critical battle phase

team_coordination.description: Advanced coordination strategies for alliances using Discord/voice chat. These tactics require real-time communication and win against stronger but disorganized opponents.

team_structure.name: 4-Team Formation
team_structure.overview: Split your 30 players into 4 specialized teams for maximum efficiency

A1.name: Attack Team 1 (Primary)
A1.role: Lead offensive pushes, initiate rallies on high-value targets

A2.name: Attack Team 2 (Support)
A2.role: Follow-up attacks, assist defense when A1 is active, take over when A1 heals

D1.name: Defense Team 1
D1.why_rank_1: Rank 1 leads defense because losing your strongest attacker to garrison duty wastes offensive potential

team_structure.substitutes: 10 subs enter after 3 minutes - use them to reinforce weak points or replace defeated players

attack_rotation.name: Continuous Pressure Rotation
attack_rotation.description: Never let the enemy rest. When one attack team heals, the other attacks.
attack_rotation.key_insight: This rotation means you ALWAYS have a fresh attack team. Enemy can never consolidate.

coordinated_strikes.name: Double Rally Strike
coordinated_strikes.description: Two rallies timed to overwhelm even strong garrisons
execution: Rally Captain calls target on Discord
A1 leader starts rally, announces 'Rally up!'
A2 leader waits exactly 10 seconds, then starts second rally
Both rallies land within seconds of each other
Individual troops from both teams follow immediately after
coordinated_strikes.why_10_seconds: 10-second gap ensures rallies land close together but not simultaneously (which could bug out). Second rally hits while garrison is still engaged with first.

final_push.name: Final 10-Minute Blitz
final_push.description: All-out coordinated assault in the final phase to flip the match
final_push.when_to_use: When trailing OR to secure victory in final 10 minutes
execution: Rally Captain: 'Final push in 60 seconds, everyone teleport to rally point'
All players use Advanced Teleport to staging area near Imperial Foundry
After rallies land: 'Everyone swarm - full troops, all marches'
Repeat on next building immediately - don't let them recover
success_factors: D teams maintain existing holdings during push

discord_callouts.name: Voice Chat Communication

roles.rally_captain: One person (usually R4/R5) calls all movements. Everyone else stays quiet unless reporting.
roles.scout: One person monitors enemy movements and reports positions
roles.timekeeper: Announces phase changes and final push countdown

standard_callouts: 'Final push 60 seconds' - Get ready for all-out assault
'GG hold positions' - We're winning, just defend

building_assignments.description: Pre-assign buildings so there's no confusion

phase_3.all_teams: Weapon Workshops are free-for-all, but coordinate final push on Imperial Foundry

f2p.focus: Target low-contest areas; gather Weapon Workshops; reinforce stronger allies

mid_spender.focus: Join whale-led rallies; support defense; capture secondary buildings

whale.focus: Lead aggressive captures; control Imperial Foundry; organize mass rallies

distribution.alliance_ranking: Based on Legion 1's final Point Ranking
distribution.personal_merit: Based on individual Arsenal Point ranking

common_mistakes.correction: 50% teleport cooldown is MASSIVE. Secure it immediately.

common_mistakes.mistake: Solo attacking instead of coordinating rallies
common_mistakes.correction: Always coordinate with alliance. Double rallies beat single attacks.

common_mistakes.mistake: Launching rallies simultaneously instead of timing arrivals
common_mistakes.correction: Time ARRIVALS, not launch times. Farther player starts first.
Maintain 4-5 player garrisons on controlled buildings.
50% of points scatter when buildings are lost. Collect them!
Use 12-minute leave for full free heal when possible.
Great F2P opportunity - these spawn randomly and give good points.
Assign one person to coordinate all movements via voice chat.

pre_battle_checklist: VIP, tech, Chief Gear buffs active
phase_priorities: Phase 1: Transit Station > Boiler Room > Prototype Sites
Phase 2: Imperial Foundry > Munitions Warehouse > Mercenary Camp
Phase 3: Weapon Workshops > Defend holdings > Target unguarded buildings

bear_trap.name: Bear Trap (Bear Hunt)
bear_trap.description: Alliance rally event where you hunt bears for valuable rewards including pet fragments and essence stones
bear_trap.overview: Bear Trap is an S-Tier event that should NEVER be skipped. Your alliance rallies against powerful bears. Rally leaders use EXPLORATION skills while joiners contribute EXPEDITION skills. Proper troop composition and hero selection are critical for success.

event_basics.skill_type: BOTH skill types used: Leaders use EXPLORATION skills, Joiners use EXPEDITION skills (top-right)
event_basics.rally_system: Leader's 3 heroes use their exploration skills, plus top 4 highest-LEVEL expedition skills from all joiners

leader_contribution.description: Rally leader's 3 deployed heroes contribute their EXPLORATION skills (active abilities)
leader_contribution.note: Use heroes with strong exploration damage skills for maximum bear damage

joiner_contribution.description: Only the leftmost hero's TOP-RIGHT EXPEDITION skill is considered from each joiner
joiner_contribution.selection: System picks top 4 highest LEVEL expedition skills from all joiners combined
joiner_contribution.tip: Level matters more than the skill itself - a level 5 mediocre skill beats a level 1 great skill

troop_composition.why_marksman: Bears are weak to ranged damage. Marksman troops deal significantly more damage to bears.
troop_composition.common_mistake: Using balanced 33/33/33 composition wastes damage potential

troop_type_scaling_note.title: Unverified: Rally Leader Troop-Type Scaling
troop_type_scaling_note.description: Some players report that the rally leader's hero class (Infantry/Lancer/Marksman) may affect damage scaling for troops of the same type. If true, using a Marksman hero as rally leader would boost your 80-90% Marksman troops more than an Infantry or Lancer leader.
troop_type_scaling_note.recommendation: To be safe, consider using a Marksman hero as your rally leader for Bear Trap. List Marksman heroes first when selecting leaders.
troop_type_scaling_note.if_verified: This would mean hero class matching matters more than raw skill power for troop-heavy compositions.

rally_leader_priority.description: For Bear Trap's 80-90% Marksman composition, prioritize Marksman heroes as rally leader (Slot 1) to potentially benefit from troop-type scaling.
rally_leader_priority.note: This only applies to the Rally Leader's Slot 1 hero. For joiners, hero class doesn't matter - only their expedition skill matters.

jeronimo_decision.question: Should Jeronimo lead or join rallies?
jeronimo_decision.reasoning: While Jeronimo's exploration skills are strong, Bear Trap uses 80-90% Marksman troops. A Marksman hero as rally leader may provide better troop-type scaling. Jeronimo can still contribute as a joiner with his +25% DMG expedition skill.
jeronimo_decision.optimal_strategy: Use your best Marksman hero as rally leader. Jeronimo joins to contribute his expedition skill.

generation_recommendations.description: Best rally leader by generation. Prioritize Marksman heroes for Bear Trap's troop composition.

gen_1_to_7.reason: Marksman heroes may provide better scaling for 80-90% Marksman troops.
gen_1_to_7.alternative: Jeronimo if your Marksman heroes are underleveled

gen_8_plus.reason: Marksman heroes with strong exploration skills maximize both troop scaling and skill damage.

gen_12_plus.reason: Late-gen Marksman heroes have powerful exploration skills plus troop-type synergy.

generation_recommendations.exception: If your Marksman heroes are severely underleveled, a maxed Infantry hero like Jeronimo may still outperform due to raw skill power.

full_allocation.description: Bear Trap gives you 1 lead rally + 6 join rallies = 7 total. Here's optimal hero placement.

critical_insight.title: When to Join WITHOUT a Hero
critical_insight.explanation: The system picks top 4 highest LEVEL skills from all joiners. If your hero has a high-level NON-COMBAT skill (gathering, march speed, healing), it could get selected over someone else's lower-level COMBAT skill like Jessie's +25% DMG.
critical_insight.rule: If your best available hero has a useless expedition skill, join with NO HERO. You still contribute troops without polluting the skill pool.
critical_insight.example: Your level 5 'Gathering Speed +50%' gets picked → wastes a skill slot → does NOTHING. Meanwhile someone's level 3 Jessie (+15% DMG) gets bumped. Better to join with just troops.

recommended: Marksman hero in Slot 1 (for potential troop-type scaling)
Natalia, Alonso, Sonya, or Vulcanus as leader
Fill remaining slots with strong exploration skill heroes

join_rallies.join_decision: Only use a hero if their expedition skill is COMBAT-relevant. Otherwise join with troops only.
join_rallies.note: Use heroes you have based on your generation. If you don't have a combat-skill hero available, join with NO HERO.

example_allocation.description: Marksman hero leads for troop scaling, joiners ranked by best expedition skill (class doesn't matter for joiners)
example_allocation.lead: Marksman hero (Natalia/Alonso/Sonya) in Slot 1 + 2 others with strong exploration skills
example_allocation.join_1: Jessie (+25% DMG) - BEST joiner regardless of class
example_allocation.join_2: Jeronimo (+25% DMG) - now available as joiner
example_allocation.join_4: Later-gen hero if available (Hendrik, Norah, Wu Ming, etc.)

full_allocation.realistic_note: Hero class only matters for Rally Leader (potential troop-type scaling). For joiners, only the expedition skill matters - pick the best attack/damage skills regardless of hero class.

best_joiners.note: #1 joiner - same effect as Jeronimo but frees him to lead
Gen 1 Epic with solid damage buff
Gen 1 Epic with attack buff - great early game option
WASTE - use him as LEADER instead. As joiner = same as Jessie.

heroes_to_avoid.reason: DEFENSIVE skill (-20% damage taken). For GARRISON defense, not attack rallies.
heroes_to_avoid.common_mistake: Many players put Sergey in attack rallies thinking he's universally good

heroes_to_avoid.reason: Stamina cost reduction + March speed. USELESS for combat - only good for Beast Hunting.
heroes_to_avoid.common_mistake: Players assume she's a combat hero because she's Epic

heroes_to_avoid.reason: Health buff (+25% HP). Better for GARRISON defense as Sergey alternative, not attack.
heroes_to_avoid.common_mistake: Health buffs don't help kill bears faster

hero_selection.slot_placement: Strongest expedition skill hero goes in LEFTMOST slot - only that skill is counted from joiners

as_leader.name: Rally Leader Strategy
steps: Fill rally with 80-90% Marksman troops
Place 3 heroes with strongest EXPLORATION skills (active damage abilities)
Hero slot order matters less for leaders - all 3 exploration skills activate
Wait for rally to fill before launching
Communicate rally timing with alliance

as_joiner.name: Rally Joiner Strategy
steps: Put hero with best expedition skill in LEFTMOST slot
Level up your expedition skills - level matters most
Join with high troop count (more troops = more damage)
Jessie is almost always the best choice for leftmost slot
If you don't have Jessie, use Jasser/Seo-yoon/Jeronimo

alliance_coordination.name: Alliance-Wide Strategy
steps: Assign dedicated rally leaders (strongest players)
Coordinate rally times so members can join
Focus on highest level bears for best rewards
Don't waste rallies on low-level bears
Track who has Jessie for optimal joiner placement

rewards.tip: Always target highest level bear your alliance can reliably defeat

common_mistakes.mistake: Using Sergey, Gina, or Patrick in attack rallies
common_mistakes.correction: Sergey = defensive (-20% DMG taken). Gina = stamina/march speed (useless). Patrick = health buff (garrison only). Use Jessie or Jasser instead.

common_mistakes.mistake: Putting wrong hero in leftmost slot as joiner
common_mistakes.correction: Only leftmost hero's expedition skill counts. Put your best expedition skill there.
80-90% Marksman is optimal for bear damage.
Bear Trap uses BOTH: Leaders use EXPLORATION skills (active abilities), Joiners use EXPEDITION skills (top-right passive buff).
Level your expedition skills! A level 5 skill beats a level 1 skill regardless of effect.

common_mistakes.mistake: Using a hero with non-combat expedition skill
common_mistakes.correction: Your high-level gathering/march speed skill can bump someone else's combat skill. Join with NO HERO if you don't have a combat-relevant expedition skill.

common_mistakes.mistake: Starting rallies without waiting for joiners
common_mistakes.correction: Wait for rally to fill - more joiners = more damage + more top skills selected.
Focus on highest level bears for best rewards per rally.

joiner_checklist: Join MORE rallies > fewer full marches (sqrt damage scaling)
Prioritize strongest alliance members' rallies (more points)
Only use hero if expedition skill is COMBAT-relevant
NO HERO is better than a non-combat skill (gathering, march speed, etc.)
Leftmost hero: Jessie = +25% DMG (DON'T use Jeronimo - he should lead)
leader_checklist: Lead with Jeronimo if you have him (wastes potential as joiner)
3 heroes with strong EXPLORATION skills (active damage abilities)
Wait for rally to fill before launching
Target highest level bear for best rewards
best_expedition_skills: Jeronimo: Use as LEADER, not joiner
quick_reference.key_math: Damage scales with sqrt(troops). Joining 3 rallies with 1/3 troops each = 73% MORE total damage than 1 rally with full troops.

frostfire_mine.name: Frostfire Mine
frostfire_mine.description: Competitive 30-minute mining battle for Orichalcum with PvP elements
frostfire_mine.overview: Players compete to gather Orichalcum by occupying veins, defeating patrol guards, and engaging in PvP. NO TROOP LOSSES - all troops are unlimited, making this very F2P-friendly.

event_basics.key_mechanic: NO troop losses - troops are unlimited and don't die permanently

veins.description: Mining nodes that generate Orichalcum over time
veins.loot_mechanic: When defeated, veins drop THREE lootable piles of Orichalcum

vein_outbursts.alerts: Banner appears 60 seconds and 10 seconds before spawn
vein_outbursts.priority: CRITICAL - Drop everything and rush these!

smelter.description: Central map objective that opens late

is_it_worth_it.explanation: The middle smelter is a trap for average players. Only the strongest players who can get there FIRST and hold it benefit. Everyone else wastes time fighting over it while missing valuable vein gathering.
go_for_it_if: You're one of the top 3 strongest players in the match
You can teleport there immediately when it opens
You have heroes available (not on cooldown)
skip_it_if: You're mid-tier or below in power
Your heroes are on cooldown from PvP
Others are already fighting over it
is_it_worth_it.better_alternative: Focus on Vein Outbursts at minutes 18-20 instead - guaranteed 4,000 each with less competition

smelter.priority: SITUATIONAL - Only worth it if you're strongest

skill_build.description: Defeat Mine Patrols to earn XP and unlock 5 skill levels. Choose LEFT or RIGHT at each level.

level_5.effect: +50 gathering speed for 60s (5-min CD, manual activation)

skill_build.skill_5_tip: Save Skill 5 activation for Vein Outbursts ONLY for maximum efficiency!

minute_by_minute.description: What to do at each phase of the 30-minute event

actions: Immediately start defeating Mine Patrols on map edges
Build up skill XP as fast as possible
Goal: Unlock skills 1-3 before first Outburst wave
Don't waste time on veins yet - skills first!
Continue hunting patrols for skill XP
Once you have skills 1-3, send ONE squad to occupy a vein
Keep main force on patrols
Watch for first Outburst alert at ~23:00 (60s warning)
DROP EVERYTHING - Outbursts spawn at minutes 8, 9, 10
Activate Skill 5 if unlocked (+50 gathering speed)
Rush to Outburst locations - 4,000 Orichalcum in 20 seconds!
This is the most valuable time in the event
Resume patrol hunting if skills not maxed
Occupy veins with available squads
Teleport to find uncontested areas if needed
Avoid unnecessary PvP - save heroes for Outbursts
DROP EVERYTHING - Outbursts at minutes 18, 19, 20
Skill 5 should be off cooldown - activate it!
Same priority as first wave - rush for these
Max out skills if not done
Occupy highest-value veins available
Prepare for Smelter decision at 7:30
IF you're top 3 power: Rush smelter immediately
IF you're mid-tier: SKIP smelter, focus on veins
Don't get baited into fighting stronger players
Continue gathering until time expires

hunting_approach.name: Hunting Strategy (F2P-Recommended)
hunting_approach.philosophy: Avoid PvP, focus on consistent accumulation
steps: Start on map periphery defeating Mine Patrols
Build up skills through patrol defeats
Prioritize Skill 1 Right (1,500 per patrol)
Save Skill 5 ONLY for Vein Outbursts
Reserve one hero squad for periodic vein occupation
Teleport strategically to find uncontested areas
hunting_approach.pros: Lower risk, consistent rewards, less hero cooldown issues

gathering_approach.name: Gathering Strategy (Competitive)
steps: Rush to high-level veins (Level 2-3)
PRIORITIZE Vein Outbursts above all else
Compete for Smelter control at 7:30 remaining
Engage in PvP to capture occupied veins
Loot scattered piles from defeated veins
gathering_approach.cons: Requires stronger heroes, more PvP exposure

rewards.primary_value: Charm Designs and Charm Guides - key materials for Chief Charm upgrades

top_rank_rewards.1st: 14-Day Blue Flame Avatar, 80 Charm Designs, 50 Charm Guides, 4,000 Gems

common_mistakes.mistake: Neglecting Mine Patrols at the start
common_mistakes.correction: Start with patrols to unlock skills - they multiply your efficiency!
4,000 Orichalcum in 20 seconds! Watch banner alerts, drop everything for these.
Save Skill 5 (+50 speed for 60s) for Vein Outbursts ONLY.
Use free teleport (6-min CD) actively to find uncontested areas.
Always send FULL march - partial marches are easy targets.
Always collect the 3 loot piles from defeated veins - free Orichalcum!
Hero cooldowns hurt gathering. Only PvP when necessary.
Activate pet/item gathering bonuses BEFORE event starts.
Smelter opens at 7:30 remaining - set a timer and rush for it!

during_event: Start by defeating Mine Patrols (skill XP)
Watch for Vein Outbursts at min 8-10 and 18-20
Keep one squad for vein occupation
dont_forget: Loot scattered piles from defeated veins
Heroes cooldown 5 min after defeat - manage carefully

canyon_clash.name: Canyon Clash
canyon_clash.description: Large-scale alliance PvP event where three alliances battle for control of ancient ruins in the Lost Canyon
canyon_clash.overview: Canyon Clash is a strategic team event where fuel management, communication, and coordination determine victory. Three alliances fight across four phases to control buildings and ultimately the Frozen Citadel.

event_basics.eligibility: Top 20 alliances by power, Furnace 16+, active in last 5 days
event_basics.key_resource: Fuel - required for ALL actions (moving, attacking, reviving)
event_basics.legion_requirements: Minimum 15 combatants per Legion, Alliance Level 6 for 2nd Legion

schedule.battle_day: Saturday or Sunday depending on timezone vote

phases.name: Preparation
phases.objective: Position your marches, plan team assignments
tips: Split into 3 teams by pre-assigning roles in Discord before the match starts
Assign 2 strong players per team with designated 'pusher' and 'defender' roles
Put your strongest player on Team 3 (Citadel assault) - they'll need the most fuel for Phase 4

phases.name: Seize & Conquer
phases.objective: Capture all buildings on your island, push into enemy territory
tips: Secure YOUR island first by sending 1 player to each neutral building before pushing out
Block enemy bridges by stationing 1-2 defenders at bridge exits on your side - forces enemies to fight through you
Don't overextend - capture only what you can hold. Each uncaptured building drains fuel to retake later

phases.name: Fortress Occupation
phases.objective: Hold fortresses for points, prepare for Citadel
tips: Assign guardians by having R4+ designate your lower-fuel players as Guardians at captured buildings
Rotate guardian duty every 5 min - Guardians recover fuel 2x faster, letting pushers refuel for Phase 4
Save your top 3-5 players' fuel for Phase 4 - they should minimize combat and let others defend

phases.name: Citadel Onslaught
phases.objective: Capture and hold the Frozen Citadel
tips: All-in on Citadel if you're strongest: Send your top 5 players simultaneously to defeat the NPC guard first, then immediately garrison
Cut off reinforcements if enemy holds Citadel: Station 2 players at each bridge leading to Citadel to intercept their reinforcements
Coordinate final push at 5 min remaining: Count down '3-2-1-GO' in voice chat so everyone attacks at once

three_team_split.description: Split your combatants into three teams for maximum coverage
three_team_split.team_1: 2 strong players - defend your island + early push
three_team_split.team_2: 2 strong players - mid-map control + fortress capture
three_team_split.team_3: Your strongest player + support - Citadel assault team

formations.flexibility: Be ready to switch roles based on battle flow

fuel_management.importance: CRITICAL - Running out of fuel mid-battle is game-losing
fuel_management.fuel_recovery: Guardians recover fuel faster - rotate guardian duty
fuel_management.common_mistake: Aggressive players run out of fuel at 50% through the event
fuel_management.tip: Monitor your fuel constantly. Better to be conservative than stranded.

frozen_citadel.importance: Most important building - massive points + bonuses
frozen_citadel.capture: Defeat the NPC guard first, then hold against enemy alliances
frozen_citadel.if_you_control: Maintain steady reinforcement flow, defend flanks
frozen_citadel.if_enemy_controls: Focus on cutting their reinforcement routes, coordinate mass assault

communication.voice_chat: Highly recommended - typing is too slow during combat
communication.pre_battle: Agree on team assignments, fallback positions, and Citadel strategy

rewards.personal_merit: Based on individual performance (kills, captures, objectives)

common_mistakes.correction: Always move with your assigned team. Solo players get surrounded and waste fuel.
Pace yourself. Phase 4 Citadel fight requires everyone to have fuel.
Secure home base first. Lost buildings on your island give enemies free points.
Guardians recover fuel faster. Rotate duty so everyone can refuel.
Announce Citadel push timing. Uncoordinated attacks just feed the defenders.
Set up Discord/voice before battle. Real-time communication wins close fights.

before_event: Set up voice chat with alliance
during_event: Phase 1: Position with your team, don't waste fuel
Phase 2: Secure your island, then push bridges
Phase 3: Hold fortresses, assign guardians, save fuel
Phase 4: Coordinate Citadel assault or disruption
Always: Monitor fuel, communicate positions, help teammates
key_tips: Fuel > aggression. Conservative play beats running dry.
3-team strategy covers more ground than blob tactics
Guardians refuel faster - rotate the role
Citadel wins games - save resources for Phase 4
Voice chat is almost mandatory for competitive play

labyrinth.name: The Labyrinth
labyrinth.description: Multi-zone exploration dungeon with weekly rotation. Uses EXPEDITION skills, not exploration!
labyrinth.overview: The Labyrinth is a permanent dungeon with 6 zones that rotate throughout the week. Each zone buffs different power sources. You get Level 10 troops provided on weekdays, but Sunday's Gaia Heart uses your own troops. Uses EXPEDITION skills despite being PvE content!

event_basics.troop_provision: Level 10 troops provided on weekdays; Sunday uses your own troops

weekly_schedule.description: Each zone opens on specific days and buffs different power sources

zones.special: Uses YOUR OWN troops - no casualties

troop_ratios.description: Ratios vary by encounter type. Fine-tune based on your zone stats - you have 5 attempts daily to experiment.

1v1_no_heroes.note: Reduce lancers when heroes aren't fighting

multi_squad_f2p.description: F2P strategy using 3 squads with different ratios

squad_1.note: Infantry-Lancer focus, Marksman heroes for buffs only

multi_squad_f2p.tip: Rotate gear across squads rather than concentrating in one formation

level_10_strategy.name: Level 10 Boss Strategy
level_10_strategy.description: Each zone's level 10 is a boss fight with better rewards. Requires adjusted tactics.
tips: Use heavier infantry ratio (53-60%) for boss survivability
Save your best attempts for level 10
Boss fights may have multiple rounds - factor in troop losses
Expedition skills matter more than troop count on bosses
If stuck, try 60/12/28 ratio - it handles multi-round fights better
level_10_strategy.rewards: Clearing all 10 stages unlocks raid feature for automatic reward collection

progression_focus.name: Push Max Stage First
steps: Use first 2-3 attempts to push your max stage
Experiment with ratios if stuck
Once you hit your wall, use remaining attempts for raid rewards
Focus on zones that buff your weakest stats

reward_optimization.name: Prioritize Valuable Rewards
steps: Prioritize Mithril and Fire Crystal Shards from rewards
Clear all 10 stages to unlock raid feature
Use raid for consistent daily rewards
Monday reset gives chance to re-earn First Win rewards
